statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Creighton 80, Bradley 76
article.story: OMAHA, Neb. (AP) -- Anthony Tolliver scored 19 points, Johnny Mathies had 16 and Creighton used an 18-2 run in the second half to rally past Bradley 80-76 Wednesday night. Creighton (12-4, 6-2 Missouri Valley Conference) also got 13 points apiece from Dane Watts and Nick Porter while staying undefeated (9-0) at home this season. Bradley (9-7, 3-5), which defeated Creighton 86-69 in Peoria 17 days ago, was led by Daniel Ruffin with a career-high 22 points. Will Franklin added 18 for the Braves, who had their MVC road losing streak extended to 14. They've lost 10 straight in Omaha. After giving up the first basket of the second half to fall behind 40-28, Creighton went on an 18-2 run in a span of five minutes to lead 46-42 with 13:57 to play. The Bluejays led by as many as seven three times before Bradley closed to 61-60 with 5:37 left. Three straight layups by Tolliver, Porter and Watts made it 67-60 with 2:33 left. It became a 9-0 run before Ruffin was fouled on a 3-point shot. He made all three to make it 70-63 with 1:01 left. The Braves closed to 77-76 in a final minute that included two 3-pointers and a 3-point play. But Creighton's Josh Dotzler made two free throws and Pierce Hibma added two more with 2.8 seconds left after Danny Adams missed a tying 3-pointer at the other end. Bradley led 38-28 at halftime, thanks to 16 points by Ruffin on 7-for-9 shooting with a pair of 3-pointers. The Braves trailed 12-6 before going on a 16-2 run in a span of 4:50. The Braves shot 59 percent (16-27) in the first 20 minutes while Creighton was a cold 33 percent (11-33) after starting the game 5-for-23 from the field. For the game, Bradley hit 43 percent (29-68) and Creighton made 40 percent (23-57) from the field. Bradley lost despite a 47-37 advantage in rebounds, but the Braves committed 19 turnovers to Creighton's nine. The game was physical throughout and three technicals were called, two against Bradley, which also took a flagrant foul.
